partintro.title: INTRO
partintro.para: An optional intro can be placed as the uppermost section. It is here that you may wish to write some opening remarks. The intro is not linked to the menu navigation buttons to the left. If no intro is desired, the first section of content will be at the top instead.

article.title: OVERVIEW
article.para:
Overview

The ReadingRoom template is designed to be used for a variety of communications such as newsletters, rfi submissions and white papers. Links: Code Library Source and Demos Documentation

article.title: USAGE
article.para:
Usage

Use the markup in content.xml as a guide for how to compose the content (i.e. tagging syntax, layout examples). Refer to formatting.xml file as a guide for styling/skinning.

Text Styling

Text can be styled in various ways. Here is bold text, italicized text and bold italic text (note: you must be using a font family that has bold and italic glyphs). Text can be underlined. Here is a link to a website. Superscript1 and subscript2 are available. You may also use non-english characters like ñ and ü, and symbols like ™, ® and €. Lightboxing

Media content can also displayed via a lightbox. article.title: CUSTOMIZATION
article.para:
Customization

Styling

ReadingRooms are styled by the formatting.xml file. There are many styling options available: Background (an image or a color) Scrollbar (track/scrub color & transparency) Fonts (use provided fonts or embed custom) Nav Menu (background size/color, text styles, masthead, footer) Lightbox (overlay color/transparency, background color, button color, text styles) Content (background color/transparency/noise/size, text styles)

Fonts

Use your own by placing swf files with embedded fonts in the fonts folder and adding them to the fonts listed in the formatting.xml doc. The fonts used in this demo and provided in the source download are licensed for free commercial usage and embedding (licenses included in the download).

Tracking

Google Analytics event tracking is built in. Simply add a tracking code to the site.xml file and event tracking will be enabled. Site load complete, section views, lightbox content views are tracked.
